page.title: 01West of Morpeth
page.content: The area is rural, very sparsely populated. The main hamlet of Molesden has a population of under 40. The countryside is divided between rough grazing for sheep and cattle, and arable crops. The land is gently rolling and of considerable charm. Most people are employed in farming, although some incomers work in nearby urban areas. Most houses not directly connected with farming have large gardens, paddock, etc., and horse ownership is popular. Just outside Meldon the Morpeth Hunt has its kennels. There is a network of public footpaths, rights of way and bridleways which offer very pleasant walking, including on the disused railway line and over fields and riverside walks.
